skill.name: backtesting-frameworks
skill.description: Build robust backtesting systems for trading strategies with proper handling of look-ahead bias, survivorship bias, and transaction costs. Use when developing trading algorithms, validating strategies, or building backtesting infrastructure.
skill.summary: Build robust backtesting systems for trading strategies with proper handling of look-ahead bias, sur...

security_audit.summary: No credential access, environment harvesting, or network exfiltration patterns detected. The content is instructional with no executable or hidden behavior.

content.value_statement: Trading backtests often hide bias and overstate performance. This skill provides patterns and checks to design trustworthy backtests.
actual_capabilities: Explain major backtesting biases and mitigations
Describe a vectorized backtest flow with costs
List core performance metrics to compute
limitations: Does not provide market data sources
Does not execute backtests or produce results
Examples are Python focused and need adaptation
Does not integrate with brokers or live trading

use_cases.title: Validate a new strategy
use_cases.description: Apply bias checks and walk-forward splits before trusting performance.

use_cases.title: Compare alternatives
use_cases.description: Use consistent cost and metric standards across multiple strategies.

use_cases.title: Design a backtest engine
use_cases.description: Follow event-driven structure and execution modeling guidance.

prompt_templates.title: Start a backtest plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a basic backtesting workflow that avoids look-ahead bias and includes transaction costs.

prompt_templates.title: Choose a backtester type
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare event-driven and vectorized backtesting for a daily equity strategy with 50 symbols.

prompt_templates.title: Set walk-forward splits
prompt_templates.prompt: Propose walk-forward train and test windows for 10 years of daily data and explain the rationale.

prompt_templates.title: Add robustness checks
prompt_templates.prompt: List Monte Carlo analyses and metrics to assess drawdown risk for my strategy returns series.

output_examples.input: Explain how to avoid survivorship bias in equity backtests
output: Use point-in-time constituent lists that include delisted symbols
Avoid data sets that drop failed companies
Document the data source and its survivorship handling

best_practices: Reserve a final test set that is never optimized
Model commissions and slippage with realistic parameters
Report drawdowns and risk adjusted metrics, not only returns
anti_patterns: Optimize parameters on the full history
Ignore delisted securities in equity universes
Assume zero trading costs for high turnover strategies

faq.question: Which platforms are compatible with this skill?
faq.answer: It is platform agnostic and works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What are the limits of the guidance?
faq.answer: It does not run code or fetch data, and it requires your market data pipeline.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my existing backtester?
faq.answer: Yes, use the patterns to review or extend your current architecture.

faq.question: Does it access my data or credentials?
faq.answer: No, it provides guidance only and does not access files or secrets.

faq.question: What if my results look too good?
faq.answer: Recheck look-ahead bias, survivorship bias, and cost assumptions.

faq.question: How does it compare to a full library?
faq.answer: It is design guidance, not a full backtesting library or engine.
